description: bull +â€Ž dog, in reference to bullbaiting.

definitionGroups.group: A breed of dog developed in England by the crossing of the bullbaiting dog and the Pug to produce a ladies' companion dog, having a very smooth coat, a flattened face, wrinkly cheeks, powerful front legs, and smaller hind legs.

entries.meaning: The original form of this breed, the British bulldog.

examples: We need a lawyer who will fight for our case, a real bulldog.
His bulldog determination was destined to bring him the opportunity he was seeking.

entries.meaning: A refractory material used as a furnace lining, obtained by calcining the cinder or slag from the puddling furnace of a rolling mill.
(UK, Oxford University slang) One of the proctors' officers.

(professional wrestling) Any move in which the wrestler grabs an opponent's head and jumps forward, so that the wrestler lands, often in a sitting position, and drives the opponent's face into the mat.

examples: The bulldog's just gone to press.

entries.meaning: Any of various species of African freshwater fish in the genus Marcusenius, a type of elephantfish.

verbs.description: bulldog (third-person singular simple present bulldogs, present participle bulldogging, simple past and past participle bulldogged)

entries.meaning: (intransitive, often with into or through) To force oneself (in a particular direction).
(transitive) To chase (a steer) on horseback and wrestle it to the ground by twisting its horns (as a rodeo performance).
